inference:
The ratio $9:\text{S}$ is equal to 3, so we have $9=3\text{S}\Rightarrow\text{S}=3$.

The ratio $\text{S}:\text{T}$ is equal to 3, so we have $\text{S}=3\text{T}\Rightarrow\text{T}=1$.

The total shaded area is the area of the large shaded square plus the areas of the eight smaller shaded squares.

The area of the large shaded square is $3^2=9$.

The area of each smaller shaded square is $1^2=1$.

Therefore, the total shaded area is $9+8\cdot1=9+8=\boxed{17}$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{17}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: We are given that $\frac{9}{\text{S}}=\frac{\text{S}}{\text{T}}=3.$ \[\frac{9}{\text{S}}=3\] gives us $S=3,$ so \[\frac{\text{S}}{\text{T}}=3\] gives us $T=1$. There are 8 shaded squares with side length $\text{T}$ and there is 1 shaded square with side length $\text{S},$ so the total shaded area is $8\cdot(1\cdot1)+1\cdot(3\cdot3)=8+9=\boxed{17}.$
